A man ran in 2020, and they went blue. I'm not saying Clinton & Harris didn't have flaws or that they ran perfect campaigns, but they were much more qualified to be president than Agent Orange. Anyone with a functioning brain whose mindset wasn't stuck in the 1950's could see it.  >Michigan‚Äôs entire state executive branch is run by women, 6 of Wisconsin‚Äôs 7 supreme court justices are women, and both Wisconsin & Michigan elected a female senator on the same ballot they elected Trump.  I'm aware of it. I'm also aware that there's a difference between electing someone to those offices and electing someone to be in charge of the entire country. Apparently, voters agree since Trump is 2-0 against women and 0-1 against men.  If Biden had not made his attempt to run for a 2nd term and allowed a real primary to take place and if a younger man had won the nomination, Trump wouldn't be in the White House right now.
